svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Extreme poverty vs. prevalence of underweight children, 2014
Prevalence of underweight children is the share of children younger than 5 whose weight for age is more than two
standard deviations below the median for the international reference population. Extreme poverty is defined as living
on less than 1.90 international-$ per day.
